poem:
**Contrasts in the Morning News**

Harland & Wolff, the shipbuilder,
sinks into administration,

while Wall Street surges,
a new high, the papers claim,

Intel, buoyed by federal money,
sails upward, triumphant —

Two stories, one tide,
a cityscape of fortunes and losses,
the delicate, whispered
balance of a world.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Government urged to help as shipmaker Harland & Wolff prepares to enter administration – business live 2.48pm BST Over on Wall Street, the Dow Jones industrial average share index has hit a new alltime high. The Dow, which contains 30 large US companies, is up 173 points or 0.4% at 41,567 points today. Chipmaker Intel is leading the risers, up 2.2%, following reports that it will win up to$3.5bn of federal grants to manufacture semiconductors". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Government urged to help as shipmaker Harland & Wolff prepares to enter administration – business live 2.48pm BST Over on Wall Street, the Dow Jones industrial average share index has hit a new alltime high. The Dow, which contains 30 large US companies, is up 173 points or 0.4% at 41,567 points today. Chipmaker Intel is leading the risers, up 2.2%, following reports that it will win up to$3.5bn of federal grants to manufacture semiconductors
